sentence: I want to get an internship because I think it'll look good on my resume.
corrected: I am seeking an internship to enhance my resume with practical experience.

sentence: [UM] I'm a psychology major at WVU.
corrected: I am a psychology major at WVU.

sentence: I looked up some internships and yours came up first.
corrected: I researched internships and found yours particularly compelling.

sentence: [UM] I'm in a bunch of clubs on campus.
corrected: I actively participate in several clubs on campus.

sentence: I got a B in honors English, which is actually pretty great for that class.
corrected: I received a B in honors English, which was a challenging class.

sentence: I don't really know what you're looking for, but.
corrected: I am eager to learn more about the qualities you seek in an intern.

sentence: [UM] good writing is always a plus.
corrected: Good writing skills are always beneficial.

sentence: [UM] I haven't actually done research yet, but I should probably learn how, and I think an internship could teach me.
corrected: I have not yet conducted formal research, but I am eager to learn, and I believe an internship could provide this opportunity.
Thank you for considering my application.
